channel.description: Recent content in Aur on blog.janosilles.com

item.title: Faster AUR builds
item.description: The process of building a package from AUR, the Arch Linux User Repository, is the following: download the PKGBUILD makepkg will download, decompress and compile the source based on the PKGBUILD compress the software into a .tar.xz package pacman will install the package via decompressing its contents into the filesystem As you can see the last two steps are quite redundant. Compressing the files to then decompress them a few seconds later.
